observation: ATAP, Inc. – Supporting the Warfighter since 1962.  Skip to content Home Products Equipment Heavy-Vehicles Maintenance Aircraft Jacks Commercial Jacks Military Jacks About Gospel RFQ Blog ATAP, INC. Aircraft Flight Line Maintenance Equipment Learn More Third Party Logistics (3PL) Support Aircraft Support Equipment & Specialty Tooling Heavy Vehicle Overhaul & IROAN Support Mission Support Aircraft Ground Support ATAP offers a wide range of aircraft support equipment.  We specialize in aircraft jacks, fuel carts, test stands, and aircraft towing equipment. EQUIPMENT Heavy We provide maintenance and repair parts for the USAF refueling fleet as well as manufacturing and overhaul support for large capacity fuel vehicles. VEHICLE SUPPORT Military Kitting We are a Third Party Logistics supplier for the USAF and DLA.  We offer a wide range of aircraft maintenance tools, cranes, stands, and expeditionary equipment. MAINTENANCE OUR MISSION IS QUALITY At ATAP, we strive to control the quality product of every item we supply or manufacture.  Quality is at the center of our supply model and is built into our processes from the time an order is placed to delivery.  Our quality system is audited and certified annually to ISO 9001:2015 and AS9100:2016 standards by independent auditors.  Let ATAP, Inc. show you how we can enhance the quality of your mission critical items. POLICY ATAP, Inc. 130 Industry Way LET US SHOW YOU THE ATAP DIFFERENCE! Connect with us G Over 2,500+ happy customers and 100,000+ completed projects.  No need to look anywhere else to get your project started. Important information: Usage Data may include information such as Your Device’s Internet Protocol address, browser type, browser version, the pages of our website that you visit, the time and date of your visit, the time spent on our pages, unique device identifiers and other diagnostic data. We'll be in touch in 24 hours or less on business days. Share your Project Ideas Name Phone Email Get in Touch Reach out by phone Phone: 256-362-2221 Fax: 256-362-2220 HOURS OF OPERATION Monday -Friday GENERAL INQUIRES 130 Industry Way, Eastaboga AL.  36260 256-362-2221 info@atap.com Thank you for visiting ATAP, Inc. |

thought: The WHOIS record confirms that 'ATAP, Inc.' is the registrant for the domain atap.com, with an address that matches the one listed on the website. Additionally, the domain was created in 1997 and has been updated recently, which suggests a long-standing presence on the web. The company's contact information on WHOIS is consistent with what is displayed on the website, including the phone number and email address. This transparency and consistency in information reduces the likelihood of the site being fraudulent based on characteristics 4 and 7. There is still no evidence of unusually low prices, unclear privacy policies, or unusual payment methods. To further solidify the legitimacy of the site, let's check for an SSL certificate.

thought: The SSL certificate for atap.com is valid and issued by Sectigo Limited, a well-known certificate authority. The certificate covers both the primary domain and the www subdomain, with a recent issue date and an expiration date in the future. This indicates that the website has a secure connection, which is a positive sign and not typical for fraudulent sites. There has been no evidence of the characteristics of fraudulent sites, such as unusually low prices, non-existent companies, inappropriate contact information, ambiguous privacy policies, or unusual payment methods. Based on the evidence gathered so far, there is no indication that atap.com is a fraudulent site. The company appears to be legitimate with a long-standing web presence, consistent and verifiable contact information, and a secure website. Without further evidence of fraud, I now know the final answer. The URL https://www.atap.com/ does not appear to be a fraudulent site.

observation.reason: The website has a verifiable long-standing presence consistent and verifiable contact information valid SSL certificate and there is no evidence of typical fraudulent site characteristics such as unusually low prices non-existent companies inappropriate contact information ambiguous privacy policies or unusual payment methods.
